IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Engages the human potential and enriches the quality of life within our communities by eliminating barriers to opportunity and to independence.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Engages the human potential and enriches the quality of life within our communities by eliminating barriers to opportunity and to independence.
IRS990.Description: Retail: Includes collection, processing and sales of donated goods and other items; provides job training and employment opportunities for people at 25 locations.

Activity2.Description: Industrial/Work force services includes: Work force development services for 2,400 individuals with barriers to employment and the Good Wheels connects working TANF recipients with low-interest loans to secure reliable transportation.

Activity3.Description: Residential includes: Services for adults with brain injuries, developmental disabilities, mental illness and deafness.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Goodwill's governing documents, conflict of interest policy and financial statements are made available to the public through GuideStar, as well as, upon request.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b: Compensation Review and Approval Process for Officers and Key Employees
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Chief Administrative Officer via Human Resources gathers data from external sources from comparable organizations to determine compensation ranges for the Executive Team and the Chief Executive Officer. The Chief Executive Officer then determines the compensation for the specific Executive Team members. The Board of Directors determines the compensation for the Chief Executive Officer. The secretary for the Board of Directors captures the decision in the minutes. The minutes are approved by the Board of Directors in its next meeting.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Agency Conflict of Interest policy is available via the intranet as well as in the employee handbook. The Board of Directors must report potential conflicts of interest at least annually. The Chief Executive Officer has delegated the responsibility for corporate compliance to the Chief Administrative Officer. Potential conflicts of interest are investigated by an independent team and reported to the Executive Team, Board of Directors Quality Assurance and Governance Committees, as appropriate for the level of conflict of interest.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11: Form 990 Review Process
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Finance Committee reviews the Form 990 prior to submission. The Form 990 is signed by the Chief Financial Officer. the board of directors is provided copy of the return prior to filing.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part III, Line 4d : Other Program Services Description
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 4: Retail: Includes collection, processing and sales of donated goods and other items; provides job training and employment opportunities for people at 25 locations. OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 5: Community Services: Our two AmeriCorps programs connect participants with non-profits to help build their organizational capacity by strengthening their volunteer programs, and increases the capacity of first responders at volunteer fire departments throughout our region. Our Good Neighbor Program distributed 4,498 shopping vouchers. OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 6: Other
